result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert G. Oglesby Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert G. Oglesby Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert G. Oglesby Jr. was found guilty of Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Robert G. Oglesby Jr. was found guilty of Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Robert G. Oglesby Jr. was found guilty of Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges (cash bond, if any 13CF778, shall be applied).
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with Victims or Co-Defts, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.
*  Make monthly payments for court obligations and supervision fees.
Do not possess or use alcohol or controlled substance verified through random breathalyzer and UA tests.  Do not conduct any business with any pawn shops or enter any such business.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Andrea Rufo.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and sentencing arguments are made.  
Counts 5 & 6 - DE is sentenced to 9 months in the KCJ (** see below).  Cash Bond on deposit in 13CF778 to be applied to any costs and any remaining balance to be paid during supervision.
Count 7 - DE is sentenced to 2 years in the WSP forthwith; 1 year Initial Confinement followed by 1 year Extended Supervision.
**All counts in 14CF606 & 14CF715 are Concurrent with each other, but Consecutive to 11CF449. 
In Count 7 DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, but is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning  & Voting Acknowledgement given.
Sentencing on 09-03-2015 11:00 am confirmed with Atty Rufo
Due to courts unavailbility today Sentencing to be rescheduled with notice to parties.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Andrea Rufo.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Counts 1, 2, 3, and 4 - Dismissed on State motion.  Counts 5, 6, and 7 - Pleas of no contest; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 7/21/15 at 2:00.  Bond continued.

Atty Zievers is currently in another court and Atty Rufo states cases will be resolved and requests a plea date for all 3 files.  Parties agree to a Plea Hearing on 6/11/15 at 9:40 AM for all files.  State will prepare a writ.

Video Conf. arrangement to be made and if case is resolved at that time then the new attorney will notify the DA's Office to prepare a Writ so he may appear.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant appears by video conference from Dodge Correctional and with Atty Karls and Atty Zievers.  Clerk: PT
Atty Karls states she has a phone conf. scheduled with DE next Tuesday and requests one more status date before the trial date.   Atty Karls is to notify the court if case is not resolved at next hearing so video conf. can be arranged and if resolved she is to notify the DA's Office so a writ can be prepared.  Status Conf. on 3/19/15 at 8:30 AM.

Atty Karls states ADA Gabriele is no longer assigned to these cases so they are requesting additional time to reach a resolution. Atty Karls requests DE be allowed to appear by phone at the next status date and if there will be a plea then she will notify the DA so a writ can be prepared for the next hearing.  Status Conf. on 2/18/15 at 11:00 AM for all 3 files.  Jury Status on 6/4/15 at 1:00 PM and Jury Trial on 6/8/15 at 8:30 AM in 14CF606.
